text: A librarian approaches the Merchant Lord with haste, offering him what he claims is a vital document that may influence the future of Marienburg. The man hardly looks trustworthy, however.
After a hefty night of drinking and a hefty bribe to boot, the jailors of Erengrad agree to release a valueable asset - allowing him to join your retinue.
You enjoyed Bordeleaux's finest wine. Maybe more than usual. After a hangover, you discover someone unusual at your side.
Master Smuggler and heir to House Van Haagen has smuggled himself aboard your convoy after he became persona non grata in Port Reaver. His crimes there too much to count.
While wandering the many markets of Miragliano, a trader approaches you offering you something of value - or so he claims.

Enjoying yet another pint of Bugman's ale, you find yourself listening to the tales of a Dwarf who knows the Wasteland better than you do. It is Guzunda Wallrattler, Swamp Dweller and patron of Clan Fooger who is looking for a lift back home to Marienburg.
Interestingly enough, you are joinged by a rather mysterious figure who might proof valueable in future endeavors.

She was probably her on Guild's Business. Yet Lisette Leerer has brought herself in a world of trouble, as Sudenberg is no longer the Free Port it once was. The Cult of Sigmar patrols the street, enforcing strict Sigmarite Laws. She needs a ticket out, and fast. Her services might come in handy.
Handsome Elvish merchants signed a partnership with you. Lucky you.
In the deck, a rat joins you. Saying his presence is proof of an unsinkable ship.
Cathay man, who wants to see a larger world, came to join you. Apparently, he was allergic to ogres and choose the sea route because of that

On your trip to Al-Haik, you bought a Cathay slave at a cheap price. The slave is keep saying he is not from Cathay. But from the looks of him, he is clearly a Cathayan, and the slave is lying for sure.

A welcome sight in Elfsgemeente, Captain Daefvid Maecross is as much Marienburger as he is Elf. His vessel sunk by Undead Pirates he managed to drift to Lothern where has been living for the past year. Eagerly, he joins your convoy seeking passage back to Marienburg.

There be no more talk of a ''Free City''. Those who are willing to join the Empire's State Army may do so, those who refuse shall face dier consequences. Unsurprisingly, all the famed regiments of Marienburg join Reikland's cause.

With the shocking shift of power over the province of Reikland, where the banner of the Free State of Marienburg now flutters proudly, even the most loyal Reikland regiments are forced to serve under their new Emperor.
House Den Euwe on the brink of bankruptcy

Little birds tell you a rival Merchant House, House Den Euwe, is nearing bankruptcy. They've gambled all their money on a trade expedition led by their heir Egmond Den Euwe. The Eastern Market and Cathayan ports is their final resolve. We've made sure this expedition is going to fail, of course -and it won't be long before House Den Euwe comes knocking to sell their assets to us dirt cheap. Or perhaps to offer us to absorb their venture entirely.

Besides being a buzzling and colourful city-state. Marienburg knows many dark corners and hidden cults. It is a brewing pot for both chaos worship and other foul beings. The Knights of Purity seek out to eradicate the heretics, but find themselves in a losing battle. With the aid of more Witch Hunters, traveling all the way from Ostermark, they might be able to turn the tide.

Little birds are discovering more and more of the predicament House Van Haagen have found themselves in. Their Heir, Crispijn van Haagen is hiding from the authorities all the way in Port Reaver. His many crimes finally unmasked due to his boisterous behaviour. \\n\\n This might present the perfect opportunity. If Crispijn is to be executed, House Van Haagen is heirless. On the other hand, the better option might be to indebt them. Perhaps we can smuggle Crispijn out of Port Reaver using a convoy, forcing him in our retinue of Gilded Route Merchants. As the saying goes: Keep your friends close, yet your enemies closer. This would demote Leo van Haagen to nothing more than one of our footmen.
Marienburg trading Convoys decided to make a trade in your lands. This time, both sides earned profits from the deal.

The whispers were.. unintelligible at first. Yet the soft hisses of Tsien-Tsin are slowly gaining their grip within Egmond's state of mind. No longer do they sound like mumblings of made up words, but now rather distinctly formulated.. Errands.The voices whisper Egmond to go North. But why? There's no trade there as Beichai is overrun by the undead. \\n\\n ''Let me unlock your vision, I can show you true richdom lies not in riches but solemnly in knowledge. Let me show you the ways of change. All you need do is raise a Shrine to my name in the City where my following is strongest''.
Arnheim, where Dark Elves and High Elves roam the same streets a artifact of mysterious magic finds it's way to you.
A brutish Norscans finds it's way to you, desperately seeking passage to new seas. His experience will surely proof valueable.
You manage to obtain a rare item that obviously oozes all sorts of magic. This will proof valueable.

The heir of House De Roelef yet not nearly as interested in the art of trade as her aunt - Clara much prefers a life of adventure. Something we can provide her on the Gilded Route, safely hidden from her aunts gaze.
You stumble upon a ship-in-a-bottle, the model has Marienburger flags draping from it's mast. Something about it tells you it should be opened with caution.
A unique artifact with clear markings of the sea. This will fetch a good price with the Cult of Manann, if we can't find use for it ourselves.

A ambassador hailing from Laurelorn, a rare sight to spot these Elves outside their forest, even as they border the Wasteland. Having her in our retinue might bolster relations with this mysterious race.
A artifact that smells like seaweed yet radiates winds of magic. It's markings resemble that of the Cult of Manann.

Captured by Skaven, sold to a Norscan Slave trader - this man is down to his luck. But he claims to hold valueable information, for a small fee we can unshackle him and free him from these brutish Northmen.
Invested with invading Dark Elves, Cathayan nobility scrambles in search for a escape. Surely we can take on a refugee for the right price.
A Bretonnian noble lost and seeking passage back home, for a fee we can surely provide.

Just before the Caravan Master was about to finish the deal, Jaan bursts into the door and examines the contracts carefully.\\n\\n"Ah, pardon me. My handler has made some oversights. Clearly, these should be rectified."\\n\\nThus, a new deal was signed.

Legendary [[url:script_link_campaign_lords]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_lords}}]]Lord[[/tooltip]][[/url]] Simon Goudenkruin has arrived, is available for recruitment, and may lead an [[url:script_link_campaign_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_armies}}]]army[[/tooltip]][[/url]] to battle.

With a majority of the directors either bribed, intimidated or persuaded to join the Van de Kuyper's conglomerate\\nthere's nobody that stands in the way of the rule over the city-state of Marienburg. From now on, every tax, law or executive decision is made by a Van de Kuypers. Jaan van de Kuypers is truly the informal ruler of a the proud trade-city. All his subordinates know the true power that makes the world spin: The power of money.
A mysterious women approaches, bearing Tsien-Tsin's mark, without having words - you allow her to join your convoy.

You have never seen a sky as beautiful as when you saw the red sun set over the architectural marbles of the Nipponese. Not only did you manage to get a good price for your wares, you've managed to make some close allies within the city. Assets that might proof of value in times to come.

It is apparent the men of Ind are skilled in the art of trade. Despite their attemps to haggle you manage to get a good deal. All was well untill they invited you to dine with them, their spices alone turn even the strongest of stomachs. You do not leave empty handed however, as a passing warrior slips you something remarkeable in one of the cities dark alleys.

These lands are riddled with odd looking creatures, despite their cold gazes they seem more than interested in what you have to offer. The only downside in any dealings is the thick slime like substance that gets caught on your expensive robes. You leave with quite the tale to tell.

The elves of Tor Elithis are different to their kin. Not in their appereance by any means, but they best their brethren in arrogance. A accomplishment to take not of. Despite their condescending they welcome your diverse cargo. You've streek a good deal and leave with a trinket you're sure will fetch a good price back home.

It is a common misconception to think the sea trade routes are the most profitable, as the rivertrade route between Marienburg and bechafen is one of the most lucrative for the Marienburger guildsmen. The Champion of the Guild, Pieter de Groot - a bear of a man nicknamed ''Big Piet'', joins your venture as you continue to explore the vast network of trade routes.
